From Madrid to Santiago de Compostela, 2019 Welcome
From Madrid to Santiago de Compostela, 2019 Robin and Katy 2019-05-26 Welcome Welcome to our photobook of our travels through Spain in May 2019. Enjoy!

Chapter 1 Goodbye Leeds We set off bright and early from our house the the Leeds train station. Next stop: Madrid. Figure 1.1: Like most trips, this one has an obligatory bike photo. Saying goodbye to Leeds.

Chapter 2 Madrid We spent 3 nights in Madrid, staying with a friendly family in Aravaca. Figure 2.1: Celebratory tapas in first place we found, Bar El 89, ‘El Bar de Toda la Vida’. Figure 2.2: Amazing street art of Madrid near the Tabacalera, a cooperatively run community and arts centre.

Chapter 3 3 Figure 3.1: Arrival in Salamanca. Enjoying the beauty of the city and the rivers. Figure 3.2: Panoramic of the historic bridge over the river and the mysterious fluff that fell from the trees like snow. Figure 3.3: Us on the historic bridge, with the main cathedral of Salamanca in the background Figure 3.4: Makeshift skatepark outside a dissused church. People have been worshipping here for almost 2 decades. 12 years ago Robin was one of them! Figure 3.5: Peaceful 3 course meal in the hidden terreza of the famous Don Quijote cafe. Figure 3.6: Casa de las Conchas, famous historic building in the old city that houses the public library.

Figure 4.12: Giant brassicas, as tall as a person. Figure 4.13: The most sheep-like dog we’ve ever seen, in the garden of a friendly local who showed us around. Figure 4.14: Robin in full ‘peregrino’ mode, complete with herbs given to us along the way. Figure 4.15: Abandoned grain stores and derilict stone buildings are a key feature of the settlements in this area. Figure 4.16: Abundant plantlife covered every surface. Suculants growing on a stone wall. Figure 4.17: Grain silos in every direction, over a darkening Galician sky. Figure 4.18: Galician garden. Allotments and gardens with delicious-looking vegetables dotted the route of el camino. Figure 4.19: A shrine to the bike. Figure 4.20: View from our window after the first day of walking the Camino. Figure 4.21: Early morning start for the megaday, in preparation for a ~40km walk from Pezos to Lalin. Figure 4.22: Poster promoting the PSOE, one of many parties campaigning for the upcoming local, regional and European elections. Figure 4.23: Reward for another long climb: stunning views and bountiful giant gorse bushes alongside bright purple heather. Figure 4.24: The most welcome refreshment of the entire trip: Iberian favourite ColaCao and Cafe con Leche at the only resting place for miles. Figure 4.25: Despite tired legs, we still had time for play. Swings on the home straight. Figure 4.26: More abundant nature. Galicia teams with waterways and greenery. Figure 4.27: Old tractor just outside Lalin, the final destination. Traditional agriculture continues apace. Figure 4.28: Enjoying the sunshine and a chance to rest our feet outside the church in the Plaza Mayor of Lalin. Figure 4.29: Robin proudly poses outside a statue of his new hero: the Galician Mathematician Ramon Aller. Figure 4.30: Lego brick staircase typifying the playful architecture in Lalin.
